image.altText: Peter Malinauskas and men from Santos stand on scaffolding at the Moomba CCS

props.synopsis: Santos says it's captured and stored 340,000 tonnes of CO2 and is on track to significantly expand operations — but an energy expert says in the scheme of Australia's 500 million tonnes of yearly emissions, it's more "PR exercise" than climate change solution.

title.children: As Santos celebrates carbon capture, expert says it's 'hardly a drop'

image.altText: A man in handcuffs is escorted through a doorway by two policemen, with one holding him by the arm

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has been sentenced for his involvement in a nightclub stabbing in Adelaide's CBD that left two people injured.

title.children: Victorian man sentenced for 'chaotic' Adelaide nightclub stabbing

image.altText: A house with red roof and red and cream brick with hard rubbish out the front

props.synopsis: Three youths accused of attempting to murder a man in Adelaide's north allegedly discussed their plans to make sure the target was dead in a group chat labelled "hit squad", a court has heard.

title.children: 'Hit squad': Six males face court over alleged botched murder attempt

image.altText: Man standing in gardens

props.synopsis: A District Court Judge has asked for more evidence as to how much a by-election would cost before deciding whether to postpone Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell's sentencing on theft and dishonest dealing with documents offences.

title.children: By-election cost raised in Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell’s fraud case

image.altText: A massage parlour with pictures of massages in a shopfront

props.synopsis: A South Australian magistrate has accepted that two women caught running a brothel did not understand the practice was illegal in Mount Gambier, which lies close to the Victorian border.

title.children: SA sex workers escape conviction because of confusion over law

image.altText: Diesel submarine at a ship yard.

props.synopsis: A former senator says the documents are a sign the government is exploring the idea of dismantling nuclear submarines at shipyards in Adelaide's north-west, but the SA minister who attended the meeting says it was not the "focus" of the discussions.

title.children: Minister rejects claim talk about nuclear waste during UK trip signals plans for SA

image.altText: A large blue sign which says police in front of a large stone walkway.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Liberal Party is highlighting an increase in thefts and break-ins in the regional city ahead of a possible by-election to replace an MP found guilty of stealing.

title.children: Opposition hits out at surge in break-ins and theft in Mount Gambier

image.altText: An overhead shot of the Whyalla circular jetty

props.synopsis: The state and federal governments today announced they will dedicate a combined $30 million to the Whyalla airport, in addition to $3.14 million from the federal government to kick start the long-awaited foreshore development.

title.children: Major cash injection for Whyalla foreshore development and airport

image.altText: Police car with officer and leafy street with houses in background.

props.synopsis: Police have responded to reports of a shooting incident in Adelaide's north-east.

title.children: Man taken to hospital after allegedly being shot in leg

image.altText: The exterior of a building with corrugated metal sheets and a bright red logo, reading APY Art Centre Collective

props.synopsis: The final investigation into allegations of interference in First Nations artwork has concluded, with the Indigenous corporation regulator saying no further action will be taken.

title.children: Investigation into 'white hands on black art' allegations concludes

image.altText: A koala looks down from the fork of a gum tree

props.synopsis: A sanctuary for up to 1,000 koalas and other wildlife is to be established on Kangaroo Island with the hope it will bring tourism and education opportunities while protecting the valuable population of marsupials.

title.children: New koala sanctuary plan for Kangaroo Island

image.altText: Adam Reilly - man with white shirt and Indigenous artwork tie looks ahead

props.synopsis: Adam Reilly has told a parliamentary inquiry it was not his decision to leave the Department for Child Protection and has called for changes to the system.

title.children: 'Hurtful rumours': Former SA child protection chief explains departure

image.altText: A metal sign on a building saying YOUTH COURT

props.synopsis: A teenage girl who had items of extremist material on her phone and school-issued laptop is just a "young, naive, Muslim girl with autism", a court has heard.

title.children: Muslim girl 'with autism' pleads guilty to possessing extremist material

image.altText: Dozens of bricks of drugs wrapped and laid out on a blue tarp

props.synopsis: Two young Victorian men who were involved in the attempted importation of more than 100 kilograms of cocaine into South Australia have been sentenced to three years in jail with a non-parole period of 18 months.

title.children: Pair labelled 'muppets' jailed over attempted 'astronomical' cocaine import

image.altText: A lone firefighter conducting a backburn.

props.synopsis: Residents living on the edge of the Grampians National Park, in the communities of Cavendish and Halls Gap, are told to prepare for difficult days ahead.

title.children: New threat to communities as Grampians fires close in

image.altText: Steve Alderson photo

props.synopsis: Golfer Steven Alderson made international headlines when he became the first winner with autism on the Golf for the Disabled Tour. He hopes to use his success to inspire others living with autism to chase their dreams.

title.children: Bullied golf champion Steve Alderson hopes to become a beacon for others living with autism

image.altText: A young Mick Jagger and Marianne Faithfull walking with their arms interlocked in front of brick buildings

props.synopsis: Between 1964 and 1970 Faithfull was a pop star, part of British rock royalty. The lows began with her use of narcotics and ended with time spent as a homeless junkie.

title.children: Marianne Faithfull remembered as a woman 'full of surprises and contradictions'

image.altText: Rain on the covers in Galle.

props.synopsis: Rain in Galle forces an early lunch and stays around until stumps after Australia picked up two Sri Lankan wickets in the morning session on day three of the first Test.

title.children: Play ends early as rain settles in on day three of first Test in Galle

image.altText: Annabel Sutherland holds up her bat and helmet

props.synopsis: Australia continues its dominance over England, whose hapless fielding efforts saw them drop seven catches on day two of the Ashes Test at the MCG.

title.children: Sutherland's brilliance sets up dominant Ashes performance as England's fielding woes intensify

image.altText: People sitting holding placards with signs about rent rises and housing affordability

props.synopsis: The number of people without long-term housing has risen by 25 per cent since 2019, as advocates say the housing crisis is pushing more people into risk.

title.children: 'Grim' numbers as Australians experiencing long-term homelessness rises

image.altText: A smiling young girl in a park.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest is set to examine whether there were system failures that led to the death of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs.

title.children: Queensland coroner to examine death of Elizabeth Struhs

image.altText: Men living in a boarding house in Sydney pose in their homes.

props.synopsis: The 28 vulnerable boarders due to be evicted from a Sydney boarding house this weekend have been given a one month reprieve, but more than half of them still have nowhere to go as the clock ticks down.

title.children: Pensioners prepare to leave 'forever home' as eviction deadline knocks

image.altText: Australian Opposition Leader Peter Dutton talks during an address to the Menzies Research Centre.

props.synopsis: After President Donald Trump's successful campaign targeting "diversity, equity and inclusion" initiatives in US workplaces, Opposition Leader Peter Dutton vows to scale back similar positions in the public service.

title.children: Mirroring Trump, Peter Dutton takes aim at diversity and inclusion workforce

image.altText: a man does a peace sign in front of a small crowd of protesters

props.synopsis: The Australian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) will consider a complaint made against Opposition Leader Peter Dutton, which accuses him of discrimination and inciting racial hatred through public statements following the Hamas terrorist attack on October 7, 2023.

title.children: Human rights body to consider complaint against Peter Dutton over Israel-Gaza commentary

image.altText: A man taking a photo of himself through the reflection of a car side mirror

props.synopsis: A Perth man who drugged multiple women before filming himself sexually assaulting them is jailed for 28 years.

title.children: 'You stole something': Perth sex predator jailed for dozens of crimes

image.altText: Three women and a man stand outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Three of the people found guilty of violently murdering a teenager in Palmerston in 2022 have been sentenced to life in prison. A fourth has been handed a 14-year jail sentence due to being aged 17 at the time.

title.children: Three people jailed for life over violent Darwin driveway murder

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A smiling woman holds her hand to her cheek

props.synopsis: Authorities in Victoria and New South Wales have issued public warnings about an unregistered cosmetic practitioner who injected patients with dodgy botox.

title.children: Suspected Victorian botulism case revealed, NSW starts investigation

image.altText: man uses tools on small orange box

props.synopsis: Investigations are continuing after an American Airlines passenger jet and a US Army Black Hawk helicopter collided midair and crashed into the Potomac River.

title.children: Black boxes found as dozens of bodies are recovered after US plane crash — as it happened

image.altText: A graffiti bird on a silo

props.synopsis: For more than a year, "Pam the Bird" soared over Melbourne, appearing on city landmarks, skyscrapers and road signs. But the cartoon bird's alleged creator could be grounded.

title.children: 'Notorious vandal': Police say accused was unemployed, sometimes violent

image.altText: Ariel Bombara speaking at a press conference

props.synopsis: An internal investigation into the actions of WA Police officers in the weeks before Mark Bombara killed two women in the Perth suburb of Floreat finds eight officers did not perform their duty.

title.children: Probe finds eight police officers at fault before Floreat murders

image.altText: George Pell

props.synopsis: Two men were compensated after the National Redress Scheme accepted they were abused as boys by the late Cardinal George Pell in Ballarat in the 1970s.

title.children: George Pell raped, groped two boys in Ballarat, compensation scheme decides

image.altText: Six dogs in the back of a buggy, a border collie in the middle is surrounded by kelpies.

props.synopsis: Collies and kelpies are beloved working dogs and pets, but each has very different personality and behavioural traits. This is what to keep in mind about whether one would suit you and your family.

title.children: Experts weigh in on why collies make better pets than kelpies

image.altText: Maree and Mervyn Schwartz smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: A north Queensland grazier accused of killing three of his neighbours has been refused bail, with the alleged offences described in court as "execution-style killings".

title.children: Grazier accused of triple murder refused bail over 'execution-style killings'

image.altText: close of donald trump inside air force one airplane

props.synopsis: Have you been paying attention to the news this week? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Check your PIN, Trump's immigration scuffle and another music festival bows out
